meanings.definition: A loud, sudden sound or noise.
meanings.sent1: The whoomph of the fireworks startled the dog.
meanings.sent2: I heard a whoomph as the balloon popped.
meanings.sent3: The whoomph of the door slamming made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The whoomph of the thunder shook the windows.
meanings.sent5: The whoomph of the explosion echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden, explosive noise.
meanings.sent1: He whoomphed the balloon to scare his sister.
meanings.sent2: The firecracker whoomphed loudly in the night.
meanings.sent3: She whoomphed the paper bag to startle her friend.
meanings.sent4: The car engine whoomphed as it backfired.
meanings.sent5: The rocket whoomphed into the sky with a burst of flames.

meanings.definition: A sudden burst of energy or force.
meanings.sent1: The whoomph of adrenaline helped him lift the heavy box.
meanings.sent2: The whoomph of wind knocked over the trash cans.
meanings.sent3: The whoomph of excitement made her jump up and down.
meanings.sent4: The whoomph of the wave crashing against the rocks was powerful.
meanings.sent5: The whoomph of the engine starting signaled the beginning of the race.
